Key Match Events: Jude Bellingham struck in stoppage time to earn England a 2-2 draw with Belgium.
Youri Tielemans scored twice for Belgium, in the 11th and 36th minutes.
Ivan Toney equalized for England with a penalty in the 17th minute on his first international start.
John Stones was withdrawn early due to an adductor injury and replaced by Joe Gomez.
Romelu Lukaku provided a sumptuous cross for Tielemans' second goal.
Post-Match Reflections: Jude Bellingham expressed that the team should be happy with their performance despite the draw.
Bellingham acknowledged the importance of taking positives from the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match had an attendance of 80,733 at Wembley Stadium.
Belgium extended their unbeaten run to 12 games under coach Domenico Tedesco.
